name: SACO Bristol - Broad Quay

reviews.text: Fantastic apartment, well placed for all activities. Central and yet quiet. Wonderful facilities - everything had been though of. Decor is modern, functional and yet warm and inviting. We wanted for nothing. We loved it so much, we are planning on staying in Saco apartments in Manchester and San Francisco and have already recommended it to friends who asked about a place to stay in Prague. Value for money, parking available and friendly, obliging, amazing staff. Couldn't recommend it more highly. PS - we just had a brilliant meal at a place just around the corner called "Graze" and it was delightful and I also highly recommend it. Great service, great food. Creme brulee to die for ;o) When booking in, please note that car access is from the rear only.
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant place.

reviews.text: The team at Saco broad quay were friendly and efficient even though they were clearly very busy during one of Bristols busiest weekends. The apartment was lovely, with good furniture and a lovely little kitchen. Would recommend this 100%, am writing this whilst I finish my morning coffee, and enjoy the free wifi, prior to checkout at the luxurious time of 11am.
reviews.title: Excellent service and lovely apartments.

reviews.text: Spotlessly clean, new furniture, TV's, Free Wifi service etc. They do offer Jumbo Service for Wi Fi at a rate of 18 GPS additional.
reviews.title: Great Staff and Location - But a few drawbacks

reviews.text: Great staff - goes ouf of their way to make your stay pleasant.
reviews.title: Can't wait for an exscuse to stay again, loved it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They are in a fantastic location for the centre of Bristol - right next to the harbourside - It can sometimes get a bit loud, but no more than any other British city centre.
reviews.title: Excellent, well located accommodation and outstanding views

reviews.text: I loved this place, from the minute I was greeted courteously at reception, to the time I opened the door of the spacious and absolutely spotless apartment, with lovely views of the river.
reviews.title: Absolutely lovely - I'm recommending this to everyone!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was large with quality toiletries (L'occitane). Shower was fantastic, basin contemporary.
reviews.title: Something a bit different

reviews.text: The bedroom was spacious with oak furnishings, and comfortable bed and nice bed-linen. (Hairdryer available in bedroom, and iron/ironing board in airing cupboard)
reviews.title: SACO BroadQuay Exceeded my expectations!

reviews.text: The open plan kitchen (fantastic) and living room opening onto balcony was spotlessly clean, and had very modern appliances. Even a cheese grater in the cupboard, and fresh milk in the fridge!
reviews.title: Very convenient location and excellent value for money

reviews.text: I loved this place, it was the sort of accomodation that you'd feel really comfortable doing a long stint in - staff were lovely, accomodation superb, (albeit it was noisy late at night from party revelleres so ask for a high floor!) and location ideal. A small supermarket just seconds away for bacon and eggs - can't get better can it??
reviews.title: Terrible. Serviced? Oh no they were not!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night in a one bedroom Broad Quay serviced apartments. Parking was limited to nearby (expensive) NPC car parks, but that's about the only negative.
reviews.title: Well furnished, new apartments in a great location

reviews.text: The location is ideal for the Hippodrome and Colston Hall and the apartments themselves are roomy and are furnished and finished to a high standard. There is a well-stocked kitchen (microwave, dishwasher, fridge/freezer, wide range of accessories and cutlery), spacious lounge and balcony and decent sized bathroom and bedroom. As you'd expect from a newly opened building, all the fittings are gleamingly new.
reviews.title: Well equipped, confortable and centrally located

reviews.text: Overall, I would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great apartment, centrally located in Bristol

aka: Saco Bristol - Broad Quay Hotel Bristol
description: Now open after a full refurbishment and under new management, these fantastic apartments are centrally located, overlooking Bristol's historic Harbourside and offer a large selection of studio, one, two and three bedroom apartments. Each apartment features designer furniture, fully equipped kitchens, spacious living/dining areas, bedrooms with king size beds and contemporary bathrooms. Some apartments benefit from a balcony or large terrace areas with great views over Bristol's popular Harbourside with its great choice of restaurants, bars, visitor attractions and independent cinema. If you're an arts fan you'll be spoilt for choice, with the Bristol Hippodrome and Colston Hall directly opposite the apartments! When you book at SACO Broad Quay, you can rest assured that you are booking with the brand that gives you MORE! Why not see out other SACO locations?
